channel.title: How to double your player count!
channel.description: So I have about 25 players online, and I want the player count to double. Like to say 50 players. How can I do this? I have been searching for a while now I can't seem to find it! Can someone please help me out?:O It says the player count in the quest tab and when I do ::Players. But it doesn't show the players online.

item.title: How to double your player count!
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

public void updatePlayerNames() { playerCount = 0; for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { i--; if(players != null) { playersCurrentlyOn = players.playerName; playerCount++; } else { playersCurrentlyOn = ""; } } }

Replace it with that.

Read full topic
item.source: How to double your player count!

item.title: How to double your player count!
item.dc:creator: @chrisrocks4122 chrisrocks4122
item.description:
@chrisrocks4122 wrote:

What do I do with this code?:S public void updatePlayerNames() {
playerCount = 0;
for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) {
if(players[i] != null) {
playersCurrentlyOn[i] = players[i].playerName;
playerCount++;
} else {
playersCurrentlyOn[i] = “”;
}
}
}

Read full topic
item.source: How to double your player count!

item.title: How to double your player count!
item.dc:creator: @imstrength imstrength
item.description:
@imstrength wrote:

[quote=“X-J-K-X, post:18, topic:462635”][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=565821.msg4115681#msg4115681 date=1349025505]

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("players")) { c.sendMessage("There are currently "+((PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount() * 2)/4)+ " players online."); while(PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount() > -1) { } }

I suggest you use this because it will make your server as successful as it deserves!!!
[/quote]

Holy.[/quote]
trolololol

Read full topic

item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

Exactly what I’ve just said… Search PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount and you should see something like…

sendFrame126("+PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount+", #);

Maybe not exactly like that, but you get the jist. Just do the same with that one.
